name: dynamic_transitive_closure
chinese_name: 动态传递闭包问题的探究
author: 孙耀峰
complexity: O(n^2) per operation for the online linear algebra method; O((m + q) log q * n^2 / w) for the offline time-segment-tree method
summary: The paper explores algorithms for the dynamic transitive closure problem in directed graphs, which involves maintaining reachability information under edge insertions and deletions. It covers static methods (Floyd-Warshall, SCC, topological sorting), partially dynamic approaches supporting only insertions (e.g., tree-merging and incremental updates), and fully dynamic solutions using offline segment trees or randomized linear algebra techniques based on matrix determinant and inverse maintenance.
